intro: Koenigia weyrichii, commonly known as the Weyrich's ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in winter. Its leaves are thick and succulent, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. Koenigia weyrichii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
